jobs_results.title: iOS / Android Developer
jobs_results.description:
Functieomschrijving

Vacancy iOS / Android developer

Full-time / Part-time, Leiden (NL)

Working at Zooma

Join our multidisciplinary team of 16 developers, designers and strategists. Small but nice, down to earth and at the same time big enough to build complex digital products for very nice clients. The common thread in what we do is that every project is customized; no project is the same and we work for clients active in very diverse sectors.

From our own coworking building we build technically challenging apps, websites and digital platforms for health insurers, universities, energy companies and the European Union. But we also work on smaller experimental digital products for startups, research projects, student associations, museums and of course our own 'Zooma Ventures ' such as TMSQR. A perfect mix of projects if you ask us!

What we are looking for

At Zooma, you will work closely with our permanent team of 16 professionals consisting of a healthy mix of seniors and juniors. From our spacious office in , all of us working from one location, everyone knows each other through and through, and Zooma's three founders, each with more than 15 years of experience, also help build the projects. We work hard but never over, and the atmosphere in the office is open and relaxed.

Team. As an iOS / Android developer you will be part of an experienced team of front-end and back-end developers, UX/UI designers, an architect and a project manager. Primarily you're an app developer, but depending on your interests, we'll give you plenty of room to develop broadly. In fact, we welcome it! Most developers at Zooma have a certain expertise but are now 'full stack' developers.

Agile / scrum. During the sprint planning and daily standups, you think about the functionalities to be built. During the sprint you pick up your stories independently and help your teammates, and vice versa. And together with the whole team you deliver the sprint (proudly :-)) to the customer and the end users. So you are involved from A to Z.

What we offer

No one is the same, thankfully, and we will do everything we can to ensure that the time you spend with the Zooma team is enjoyable and familiar. Zooma is certainly not perfect, as a company we also learn every day, but the lines of communication are short and we can move quickly.

Diverse and challenging work : we build digital products for everyone; from startups to multinationals. No project is the same and always customized. Left or right, we deliver top quality.

A very nice workplace : you work from ; Zooma's own coworking building where we work (and have drinks ;-)) on great projects with about 15 other companies from the creative industry.

Hybrid working : in principle, Mondays and Fridays are fixed office days. The rest of the week you can decide whether to come to the office or work from home.

Daily lunch : we have lunch together in the cafe of . Just cozy, setting the table together for the healthy lunch. And if you miss something, we will gladly order it for you :-)

An excellent salary : depending on your experience you get a nice salary + vacation allowance. Twice a year we discuss together how you have developed within the Zooma team.

Annual bonus : if the possibility exists, Zooma pays out an annual bonus to everyone who has contributed, divided in proportion to the salary earned in that year.

Pension contribution : we think it is important that you think about your pension. We do leave the choice of whether and how to do so to you by paying you a pension contribution.

Vacation days : You get 25 vacation days based on full-time work (40 hours per week).

Think of a phone, laptop or when necessary home office supplies.

Travel allowance : in principle we are in favor of biking to work. You can lease a bike through Zooma. But of course you can also get an NS card or a travel allowance.

Drinks, labs, events : The Dorus , gaming and table tennis during the friday afternoon drinks, going out / eating out with each other, Zooma labs and every two years a big trip together!

Study, courses, fairs : we as Zooma want to stay on top of the latest tech & design developments. So if you see something fun: 'do it' and share the knowledge gained during Zooma Labs.

But that will be very rarely, just ask Zooma people!

Are you interested?

Let's explore the possibilities together!

Send us an email at .

Opleidingsniveau: HBO
Carrièreniveau: Ervaren
Uren: 40 uur per week

jobs_results.title: Vacature in Zeist: Senior Android Mobile Developer gezocht voor UNIEK product!
jobs_results.description:
ID:10681-35096

De Organisatie:

Deze organisatie bestaat nu ruim twee jaar en ze hebben inmiddels meerdere onderscheidingen gekregen op het gebied van software innovatie. Daar zijn ze trots op en het gaat goed met het bedrijf. De focus van dit bedrijf is het beschikbaar stellen van draagbare chips waarmee allerlei specifieke data verkregen kan worden. Een simpel voorbeeld is het mogelijk maken van klantpatronen in winkelstraten of koopgedrag van consumenten op basis van hun looppatroon.

Het is unieke software en daar komt nu ook veel mobile development bij kijken. Het IT team is relatief nog klein maar ze groeien hard. In totaal werken hier nu 10 medewerkers en er wordt nu hard gezocht naar meerdere IT Software Developers. Ben jij die ervaren Android Developer die wij zoeken?

De Functie:

In deze functie ben jij in eerste instantie de enige Android Mobile Developer en je gaat intensief samenwerken met de huidige Lead Developer. Wij zoeken iemand met al enige jaren ervaring als Java Android Mobile Developer aangezien je direct aan de slag mag gaan met concept plannen. Je gaat software maken voor Beacons. Dit zijn apparaten die overal geplaatst kunnen worden en deze Beacons verzamelen relevante informatie voor allerlei bedrijven die gebruik maken van die Beacons.

Jouw software zorgt er voor dat de gebruiker via zijn mobiele toestel gemakkelijk toegang krijgt tot alle informatie afkomstig van de geplaatste Beacons.

Tezijnertijd mag je nieuwe mensen aan gaan nemen en dit kan snel gaan. Je salaris is goed, de arbeidsvoorwaarden zijn flexibel en er is genoeg groei mogelijk!

Stap jij in bij dit ambitieuze startup achtige bedrijf te Zeist?

Gevraagd Profiel:

– HBO/ WO opleiding afgerond, bij voorkeur richting IT;

– Meerdere jaren ervaring als Mobile ontwikkelaar, 2 jaar of meer;

– Ervaring met moderne programmeertalen;

– Je hebt gedegen kennis van Android en Android Java App Development;

– Goede kennis van JavaScript, JSON, Ajax, GIT en alle andere standaard tools en frameworks;

– Communicatief vaardig en een goede instelling om te kunnen werken met specialisten.

Arbeidsvoorwaarden:

29 vakantiedagen, goede reiskostenvergoeding, laptop en mobiel van de zaak, flexibel beginnen, mogelijk om 32 uur te werken.

Interesse? Neem dan contact op met Toon Klaassen via telefoon op: 0625018100 of via mail op: toon@careervalue.nl! Ook kan je hem een Whatsapp bericht sturen waar hij direct op zal reageren. Hij zorgt er voor dat je in dezelfde week al op gesprek kunt gaan!

Salaris:

3500 – 5000 euro

Functie met:

Vaste werklocatie, werken in een vast team, niet te ver reizen, vaste werkplek, vaste standplaats

Specialisatie:

Native Developer Android

Gerelateerd:

Android developer, Android SDK, Android Java, Apps ontwikkelen, Mobile, app development, app developer, Native

Plaatsen in de omgeving:

Bilthoven, Driebergen, Bunnik, De Bilt

Gerelateerde vacatures:

Utrecht: Xamarin Developer | Veel of weinig ervaring!
Utrecht: Mobile Developer met volledige Cloud focus!

Contact:

Reageren op deze vacature? Neem dan contact op met:
Toon Klaassen op telefoonnummer: +31 (0)88 88 33 067 of mobiel: +31 (0)6 25018100.
Solliciteren kan ook door te mailen naar toon@careervalue.nl of via WhatsApp.

Getagd als: vaste werklocatie

jobs_results.title: Android kotlin developer
jobs_results.description:
About the Company

Welbo is redefining how robots integrate into our daily lives. It's not about science fiction or far-off futures – it's about solving real-world problems today. From welcoming visitors at office buildings to reducing loneliness in elderly care, or safely delivering medication in hospitals, Welbo's robots are designed to enhance human interactions and make life easier.

As a tech company based in Amsterdam, Welbo is pioneering social robotics in industries where human connection and efficiency are critical. With labor shortages and the increasing need for smart automation, Welbo is meeting these challenges head-on with innovative, user-friendly robots. These aren't just machines; they're tools for meaningful interaction, powered by cutting-edge technology like AI and machine learning.

What sets Welbo apart is its focus on creating technology that truly works for people. The team prioritizes reliability, simplicity, and adaptability, ensuring robots can seamlessly integrate into any environment. Whether it's scanning a badge, guiding someone to the right meeting room, or just recognizing when someone needs help, Welbo's robots are built to anticipate and respond to human needs.
Job Description

You will join a small, passionate team of four developers, all deeply involved in every aspect of the product – from coding and testing to installation on-site. Your primary focus will be on backend development using Node.js, as that's where most of the intelligence and logic lives.

The role spans fullstack responsibilities, so you'll also work with Kotlin for Android (for tasks like robot navigation) and React.js (for the user-facing applications). You'll help simplify and optimize the existing codebase while building new features to unlock the full potential of Welbo's robots.

Key goals include creating seamless human-robot interactions, integrating cutting-edge tools like ChatGPT, and ensuring reliability, even in challenging environments.
Your Responsibilities
• Build and maintain backend systems with Node.js, ensuring high reliability and efficient communication between robots and servers.
• Work with Kotlin for Android to improve robot functionality, such as navigation and task execution.
• Develop user-facing features in React.js, delivering intuitive interfaces for clients.
• Test, debug, and optimize code both in-house and on-site at client locations.
• Collaborate with the team to design and implement new functionalities, from badge scanning to medication delivery.
Requirements

We value skilled developers who are passionate about their craft. You don't need to tick every box – if you're strong in either Node.js or Kotlin Android, we're happy to help you learn the rest.

Here's what we're looking for:
• At least 2 years of professional experience in software development in either Node.js or Kotlin Android (hobby projects or personal initiatives are a plus).
• Desire to work with all the techniques described in the vacancy.
• A solid understanding of system communication protocols (e.g., MQTT).
• An intrinsic motivation to code and learn.
What We Offer

Salary: €2,800–€4,500 per month (depending on experience).

Flexibility: Work two days a week at the office; the rest is up to you.

Travel allowance: NS Business Card or €0.23/km.

Equipment: Choose your own laptop.

Perks: Monthly team outings, €25 mobile allowance.

Work-life balance: Few rules, lots of autonomy.

jobs_results.title: Software Developers: Java, .Net, Android, IOS, Objective C
jobs_results.description:
• Behoor jij tot de veel gevraagde groep IT-professionals die over (ruime) kennis en ervaring beschikt van de nieuwste technologieën?
• Ben jij kritisch ten aanzien van de werkgever en het type opdrachten?
• Wil jij je tijd ook beter besteden dan aan auto-/file rijden?

Wat wij bieden

Onze opdrachtgever is een kleine high level IT organisatie, gevestigd in de regio Den Bosch, met een hoge productiviteit en een gezonde ambitie en drive om te groeien, ingegeven door de grote vraag naar de professionele dienstverlening van deze organisatie.

Deze organisatie kan je op al de genoemde aspecten tegemoet komen en jou een uitdagende, professionele en plezierige werkomgeving bieden, met:
• Participatie in grote en complexe projecten in hoogwaardige technologische en zakelijke omgevingen;
• Opdrachtgevers binnen de regio die hoge verwachtingen hebben omtrent professionaliteit;
• Volop mogelijkheden tot opleiding en ontplooiing en actieve ondersteuning door collega’s en management;
• Bovengemiddeld arbeidsvoorwaardenpakket, waaronder een uitstekend salaris en concurrerende pensioenregeling.

Wat neem je mee?

Developers / Designers die voor deze organisatie in aanmerking willen komen, zijn méér dan bekend met meerdere of een combinatie van onderstaande tools, hulpmiddelen, werkwijzen:
• Java development tools, Spring, Hibernate, Struts, JS, Ajax, EJB3
• HTML5/CSS/Javascript
• jQuery, AngularJS, RequireJS, Underscore.je, Node.js
• C# .Net designer/developer, .Net Framework, WPF, Visual Studio
• LINQ, SQL Server MySQL
• JSON, XML, Eclipse
• Android, iOS, Objective C, SDK, NDK, UI
• Agile, Scrum, Test Driven Development
• Cloud Technology

Daarnaast is belangrijk:
• HBO / WO opleiding met een link naar software development;
• Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden en uiteraard gedreven en gemotiveerd;
• Uitstekende kennis van Nederlands en Engels;
• Georganiseerd, teamplayer en kennisdeler;

Reageren?

Wij zijn per direct op zoek naar jou! Dé Professionele Software Developer/Designer die het als een uitdaging ziet deze organisatie en haar opdrachtgevers te overtuigen dat jij je kan meten met de hoge verwachtingen en professionaliteit die hier gevraagd wordt. Reageer naar Gerd van der Cruijsen van LRM Group. Email; gvdcruijsen@lrmgroup.nl. Bel voor info naar 06 222 03140.

Gebruik daarbij de ref.code: HT-Dev

jobs_results.title: Software Engineer​/Android​/Kotlin Platform Products Platform Prod
jobs_results.description:
Position: Software Engineer (Android/Kotlin) Platform Products Platform Prod[...]
Responsibilities
• Contribute to the technical design of Android solutions
• Develop and maintain visualization features on top of Tom Tom’s map renderer
• Develop online and onboard applications for in-car multi-screen platforms and mobile devices
• Work with a complex Android codebase including Kotlin and SWIG generated Java
• Bring new and creative, innovative ideas to the table.
What you'll need
• Excellent, hands-on programming skills in Kotlin and Java with proven working experience
• Solid knowledge of Android platform and architecture components
• Strong communication skills across functions (UX, Product Management, Operations)
• Openness and willingness to support others
• Passion for continuous improvement and experimentation
• Product minded with UX/UI knowledge and exposure.
What’s nice to have
• Master's degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science or equivalent
• Experience with SWIG
What we offer

A competitive compensation package, of course.

Time and resources to grow and develop, including a personal development budget and paid leave for learning days, as well as paid access to e-learning resources such as O’Reilly and Linked In Learning.

Time to support life outside of work, with enhanced parental leave plus paid leave to care for loved ones and volunteer in local communities.

Work from home, the office, or even abroad – each team has the flexibility to choose how they work based on business needs.

Improve your home office with a setup budget and get extra support with a monthly allowance.

Enjoy options to work from your home country and abroad for a set number of days each year, to visit family and friends, or to simply explore the world we’re mapping.

Take the holidays you want with a competitive holiday plan, plus an extra day off to celebrate your birthday.

Join annual events like our Hackathon and Dev Days to bring your ideas to life with talented teammates from around the world.

Become a part of our inclusive global culture and have the chance to collaborate with a diverse community – we have over 80 nationalities at Tom Tom!

Find out more about our global benefits and enjoy additional local benefits tailored to your location.
Meet your team

We are the Map Visualization Product Unit. We develop map rendering technology that can be integrated into navigation systems and location-based applications, providing our technology to our customers in the form of cloud-based APIs and SDKs.

We see quality-management processes as a source of competitive advantage. As part of our product-led and outcome-oriented culture, we believe it is crucial to have mechanisms in place to measure and improve the quality of our products in a continuous manner so we can achieve our mission of mapping the world in real time.
At Tom Tom...

You’ll help people find their way in the world. In 2004, Tom Tom revolutionized how the world moves with the introduction of the first portable navigation device. Now, we intend to do it again by engineering the first-ever real-time map, the smartest and most useful map on the planet.

Work with a team of 3,700 unique, curious and passionate problem-solvers. Together, we’ll open up a world of possibilities for car manufacturers, enterprises and developers to help people understand and get closer to the world around them.
After you apply

Our recruitment team will work hard to give you a meaningful experience throughout your journey with us, no matter the outcome. Your application will be screened closely and you can rest assured that all follow-up actions will be thorough, from assessments and interviews all the way through onboarding. To find out more about our application process, check out our hiring FAQs.

Tom Tom is an equal opportunity employer.

Tom Tom is where you can find your place in the world. Every day we welcome, nurture and celebrate differences. Why? Because your uniqueness is what makes you, you. No matter your culture or background, you’ll find your impact earch also shows that sometimes women and underrepresented communities can be hesitant to apply for positions unless they believe they meet 100% of the criteria.

If you can relate to this, please know that we’d love to hear from you.
#J-18808-Ljbffr

jobs_results.title: Android Engineer
jobs_results.description:
Android Engineer

Are you an EU citizen looking for the next big move in your developer career?

OfferZen companies across Europe are hiring Android Engineers.

Companies on OfferZen are looking for Android Engineers to assist and manage with the architecture, implementation and maintenance of scalable mobile applications and services.

Requirements:
• 2+ years experience of relevant experience
• Strong hands-on knowledge of Java and Kotlin
• Develop and support software including applications, database integration, interfaces, and new functionality enhancements
• Experience working in an English speaking environment

Skills:
• Analytical mindset and good problem-solving skills
• Optimization of the application for maximum speed and scalability
• Implementing automated testing platforms and unit tests
• Data migration, transformation, and scripting

Nice to have:
• Attention to detail
• Experience building an approved Play store App
• Experience with Flutter or Dart
• Seniority is based on experience/knowledge

Make this the last job ad you ever click on: OfferZen is a platform that reverses job searching: Companies apply to interview you with upfront tech stack, role, and salary info. You also work with a specialised career coach, who helps you win at the interview process.

How OfferZen works:
• Sign up for free and complete your OfferZen profile
• Become visible to 2000+ companies across Europe and Africa
• Have companies apply to interview you
• Navigate interviews and offers with the help of your career coach
• Land your dream dev job!

jobs_results.title: Sportieve Android Developer
jobs_results.description:
Ben jij klaar voor een rol als coach van verschillende Android sport applicaties? Heb jij het in je om sport nog mooier en beter te maken door next level tools te ontwikkelen? Ben jij een IT`er met een sporthart en wil je deze passie graag overbrengen op andere sportfanaten?
Het spel

We spreken hier over het hoogste niveau, geen FC Groningen – 1.FC Union Berlin, maar Barcelona FC – Liverpool FC. Jij bent de drijvende kracht achter het bedenken en ontwikkelen van nieuwe Android applicaties en het verbeteren van bestaande spelpatronen en standaardsituaties.

Ideeën van de spelverdeler vertaal jij in innovatieve, native apps met een tof design. Je houdt hierbij in gedachten dat de applicaties voor iedereen gemakkelijk te gebruiken moeten zijn en je lost alle bugs op. Van jou wordt verder verwacht dat je:
• Een sporfanaat bent
• Zelfstandig kunt en wilt werken
• Een echte teamspeler bent
• Geïnteresseerd bent in de nieuwste technologieën en ontwikkelingen
• Ervaring hebt met het bouwen van native Android apps
• Vloeiend Java en/of Kotlin spreekt
• Een customer centric approach hebt
Jouw contract

Parttime (32 uur) of fulltime (40 uur) werken bestaat tot de mogelijkheden. Naast het uitvoeren van opdrachten van de head coach, krijg je de ruimte om eigen ideeën en concepten te ontwikkelen.

Samen met je teamgenoten maak je de sportwereld en maatschappij nog mooier en beter. Ons team van UX & UI designers, back-end, front-end en mobile developers kan elke sportuitdaging aan en loopt voorop in de competitie qua innovatie.

Niks anders dan het beste voor ons team, je krijgt daarom een top-notch MacBook en hebt flexibele werktijden. Wanneer je geblesseerd bent, kun je ook vanuit huis werken. Je kunt een competitief salaris verwachten met vakantietoeslag. En natuurlijk genoeg vakantiedagen om uit te kunnen rusten van turbulent seizoen.

Ons kantoor in Apeldoorn is gevestigd in een pand met diverse andere talentvolle IT teams. Het is dus niet lastig om af een toe potje tafeltennis te spelen met een waardige tegenstander. Alhoewel we allemaal fanatieke sporters zijn, wordt een borreltje op de vrijdagmiddag natuurlijk niet overgeslagen.

Aanvragen van Mino Raiola worden niet op prijs gesteld.

jobs_results.title: Android developer
jobs_results.description:
Taakomschrijving:

Our Android developers work entirely in Kotlin and with well-known standards such as Android Jetpack, Coroutines, Room/Realm/Retrofit/OkHttp, Git and Firebase.
Aanbevolen functies
• Zachtheid
• Aanpassingsvermogen
• Communicatie
• Initiatief
• Nieuwsgierigheid
• Flexibiliteit
• Concurrentievermogen
• Behendigheid
Informatie over cv's :

Om op deze functie te solliciteren, moet u een CV van hoge kwaliteit maken. Zie hieronder voor enkele tips over hoe u een geweldig CV kunt maken.

Ga meteen ter zake. is een eenvoudige tip, maar wordt door kandidaten zeer genegeerd; Verdeel de inhoud van het curriculum op basis van onderwerpen; Vermijd opmaak die afwijkt van de regels; Gebruik eenvoudig maar passend taalgebruik; Vermijd pretenties op salaris; Maak een zorgvuldige beoordeling; Vertel de waarheid, wees eerlijk!< /p>Cv-inzending

Let op de sollicitatiepagina goed hoe het cv wordt verzonden.

jobs_results.title: Senior Java and Kotlin developers wanted in Rotterdam for challenging projects
jobs_results.description:

WE WORK TOGETHER WITH OUR CLIENTS IN THE SAME SYSTEM: YOUR APPLICATION WILL BE IMMEDIATELY SEEN BY THEM.

﻿﻿Our client is a premium consulting company specialized in providing talented and highly skilled international professionals in the fields of Java and Kotlin development in the region of Rotterdam with:

﻿﻿Awesome challenging projects at large companies - steep learning curve

﻿﻿A salary that matches your skills, experiences and ambitions

Personal development plan to become the expert in new technologies

Profit sharing Plan: 25% of the company's profit is shared among all developers

26 paid holidays

Educational budget of 3,000 euros per year

R&D Hackathon days with the team (multiple times of the year)

Work with the latest cutting-edge technologies at their clients

Dutch language courses for you and your family

Laptop of your own choice

Transportation budget

Pension scheme, based on your personal situation

If applicable: sponsorship for the visa application for you and your family

30% tax ruling can be applied

﻿﻿﻿YOU HAVE:

A bachelor or masters degree in computer science/engineering

5+ years experience as a software developer in the Java ecosystem

Outstanding coding skills: it always works!

The ambition to become to grow and learn to become the best software developer possible

An independent mindset: you dont wait for a briefing to get something done. You already know what needs to be done and come up with the best solution

Good knowledge of databases (relational and non-relational)

Worked in Agile/Scrum/Kanban teams

Experience with working with microservices

Basic knowledge of the latest front-end frameworks (Angular, React, Vue.js)

Good skills in English (writing and speaking)

A curiosity to discover the latest technologies

The willingness to share your experience with other developers at conferences, meetups and/or in blogs
﻿
﻿Interested? ﻿Apply now and we will be in touch within 24 hours.
